[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Partial voting abuse] In partial governance voting scenarios, can repeated calls to this function with small specified_voting_power values allow voting power to be spread across multiple proposals simultaneously? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Dust attack] Can an attacker submit thousands of votes with specified_voting_power=Some(1) to fragment voting power into dust amounts, making vote tallying expensive and potentially causing consensus timeouts? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Delegation pool bypass] For delegation pools, does this function properly track individual delegator voting power, or can pool operators exploit it to vote with more power than delegators authorized? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Type coercion] Can passing specified_voting_power with values that cause type coercion issues (e.g., very large numbers close to u64::MAX) lead to unexpected voting power assignments? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Validator collusion] Can Byzantine validators collude to provide different remaining_voting_power values to different callers, causing vote count discrepancies that could halt governance or enable double-voting? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Atomic violation] Is the voting power check and return atomic with respect to the on-chain state update? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: check_remaining_voting_power()] [Flash loan attack] Can an attacker use flash loans or similar mechanisms to temporarily boost their stake, call this function to lock voting power, then repay the loan, allowing voting without sustained economic stake? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: is_partial_governance_voting_enabled()] [Feature flag bypass] Can an attacker manipulate the Client object to return incorrect feature flag values, enabling or disabling partial governance voting contrary to on-chain consensus? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: is_partial_governance_voting_enabled()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability where the feature flag state changes between checking at line 34 and actually processing a governance vote, allowing rules to be bypassed? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: is_partial_governance_voting_enabled()] [State inconsistency] Can validators see different feature flag states due to network delays or state propagation issues, causing some to enforce partial voting rules while others don't, breaking consensus? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/governance/utils.rs] [Function: is_partial_governance_voting_enabled()] [Error handling bypass] If get_feature_flag() fails with an error, does the function default to enabled or disabled?
